post.title: Introduction to JSON
post.body: JSON stands for JavaScript Object Notation. It is a lightweight data format used for storing and exchanging data.

post.title: Working with Arrays
post.body: JSON arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable. Each element can be an object, array, string, number, or boolean.

post.title: Understanding Objects
post.body: JSON objects are collections of key-value pairs. Each key is a string, and values can be any valid JSON type.

post.title: Common Use Cases
post.body: JSON is commonly used for APIs, configuration files, and data storage in web and mobile applications.

post.title: Parsing and Stringifying
post.body: In JavaScript, you can convert JSON strings into objects using JSON.parse() and convert objects back into JSON using JSON.stringify().
